visual_tags: low ponytail, thin black rectangular glasses
yellow rubber duck named Murphy nearby
dark hoodie with company logo, eager expression

global_style.style: Render a Modern Graphic Novel with sharp, crisp details; absolutely no motion blur. Text & Speech Bubbles: Speech bubbles must not touch or overlap panel edges. Bubble tails must clearly point to the speaking character’s face. All text must be highly visible and accurate, using clean sans-serif comic lettering with at least 5px padding inside bubbles.
global_style.line_style: Bold, clean ink outlines with slight thick-to-thin variation for depth. Shading: Minimal cross-hatching, mainly soft cel shading plus subtle halftone dots in shadow areas.

panels.scene_description: Evening SRE war-room. Deploy-bot shows checkout-service v2.4.1; dashboards glow green. Mei points a stylus at the deploy feed while rookie Alex writes the version on a sticky note. Murphy sits on Mei’s notebook.
panels.learning_objective: Track every deploy and tag it with the service owner.
panels.takeaway: 70% of incidents trace back to a fresh change.

speech_bubbles.mei: Know what changed before you blame what broke.

panels.scene_description: Alert banner turns red. Mei hands a laminated 5-Question Drill card to Alex; JC checks dashboard clocks.
panels.learning_objective: Apply the 5-Question Drill in under 90 s.

speech_bubbles.mei: Five answers in ninety seconds—calm incident.

panels.monologue: Triage is choreography—practice until it’s muscle memory.

panels.scene_description: CI monitor shows 'render-dashboards.yml — PASSED'. Holographic diff overlay reveals Jsonnet code next to a Grafana screenshot. JC and Mei high-five.
panels.learning_objective: Store RED dashboards in Git and ship via CI.

speech_bubbles.jc: Merged! Every service inherits a RED board.

panels.monologue: Dashboards in Git don’t drift at 2 a.m.

panels.scene_description: Whiteboard diagram: raw alerts → group → dedup → PagerDuty single incident. Mei marks duplicate alerts collapsing into one.
panels.learning_objective: Group, deduplicate, and route alerts with labels.
panels.takeaway: One grouped page beats thirty duplicate pings.

speech_bubbles.mei: Noise down, clarity up—labels save lives.

panels.monologue: Service + impact labels are the routing GPS.

panels.scene_description: Graph spikes then falls as webhook toggles off a feature flag. Mei smiles; Murphy wears a tiny nurse cap with a green check mark.
panels.learning_objective: Auto-rollback common P2/P3 incidents within 60 s.
panels.takeaway: Alerts that fix themselves preserve sleep.
panels.monologue: Count attempts vs successes—automation deserves an SLO too.

panels.scene_description: Gremlin badge shows 'Latency Drill Passed'. Mei gives thumbs-up; green check glows over SLO dashboard.
panels.learning_objective: Use chaos drills to prove SLOs and self-healing.

speech_bubbles.mei: Break it safely now—or break for real later.

panels.monologue: Chaos must honor blast radius and have a big red halt button.

panels.scene_description: Grafana trend chart 'RPS vs CPU – 12-Month' shows slight dip; JC points, Mei writes 'Tune JVM heap' on task board.
panels.learning_objective: Run monthly spike & soak tests and graph capacity trends.

speech_bubbles.mei: Trend slipped 6 %. Time for heap tuning.

panels.monologue: Autoscalers fail quietly—graphs shout the warnings.

panels.scene_description: Team stands on stylized staircase labeled Habits → Templates → Automation → Validation. Murphy waves a flag reading 'Day 5'.
panels.learning_objective: Connect habits → templates → automation into a feedback loop.
panels.takeaway: Track, template, test, and teach—continuous SRE growth.

speech_bubbles.mei: Keep climbing—the view (and uptime) only get better.

panels.monologue: Reliability is never done; it’s improved sprint by sprint.
